results.title: A Heritage to build on
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, Humphrey Swingler and Derek Williams
results.brief_description: Made as part of the Cement and Concrete Association’s contribution to European Architectural Heritage Year 1975, shows the many types of Britain’s old and modern architecture. It contrasts the present time, when renewal and renovation of urban environment is a matter of concern, with the past. It shows that with thoughtful use of today’s materials such as concrete, old and modern buildings can be compatible with those of the past.

results.title: A Heart in winter = Un Coeur en hiver
results.creator_credit: Film Par Film, Cinea, Orly Films, SEDIF, D.A. Films, Paravision International, FR3, Jean-Louis Livi, Philippe Carcassonne and Claude Sautet
results.brief_description: Daniel Auteil and Emmanuelle Beart (the leading actors from Manon Des Sources) star in this triangular love story which explores the darker recesses of the heart and soul; where emotion is repressed. Two longtime friends in the classical music world find their friendship is threatened when a beautiful woman enters their lives. Ravel’s music forms a striking background to the drama as one woman embarks on a journey of surrender to passion.

results.title: A Hard day's night
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Walter Shenson and Richard Lester
results.brief_description: Starring the Beatles, this comic fantasia with music uses a multitude of cinematic gags. An enormous commercial success, it led directly to all the kaleidescope swinging London spy thrillers and comedies of the late sixties. In this film the Beatles, harrased by their manager and Paul’s grandpa, embark from Liverpool by train for a London television show.

results.title: A Hard course
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Stanley Williamson and Arthur Smith
results.brief_description: The arguments for and against the system of intensive training for boys and girls at the Outward Bound Mountain School in Cumberland. The school aims at “character training through adventure and testing experience”.

results.title: A Harbour goes to France
results.brief_description: The official British Army and Admiralty film of “Operation Mulberry”, the unique prefabricated harbour which was floated across the English Channel in sections, and erected in a matter of hours on the coast of Normandy during the critical days following D-Day, World War II.

results.title: A Happy childhood
results.brief_description: An English language version of a Russian propaganda film promoting the virtues of Stalinist policies for the protection of children’s welfare. If much of this socialist child-rearing looks severe and Spartan, the film is punctuated throughout by genuine moments of charm and whimsy. In many respects this is an enchanting film; accordingly, the film is a fascinating study in propaganda cinema.

results.title: A Handful of dust
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Stagescreen, Derek Granger and Charles Sturridge
results.brief_description: Tony and Brenda Last (James Wilby and Kristin Scott Thomas) appear to be the perfect married ccouple - with money, position, a great country house and an adored son, John Andrew. When Tony inadvertently invites John Beaver (Rupert Graves), an idle and penniless young socialite, to stay for the weekend, he sets in motion a series of events which drastically disrupts the course of all their lives. Brenda drifts into an affair with the worthless Mr. Beaver, with disastrous consequences, particularly for Tony, who remains unaware of Brenda’s betrayal until the tragic death of their young son. As Brenda leaves home to take up a precarious life with her lover in London. Tony sets sail with an eccentric explorer on an expedition to the South American rain forests. Lost in the jungle and stricken by fever, Tony is rescued from death by the eccentric half-caste Mr. Todd (Alec Guinness) with unexpected and sinister results.

results.title: A Gumby adventure
results.brief_description: Relive your favourite Gumby moments in this compilation tape as Gumby and Pokey are involved in an assortment of adventures and mishaps. Episodes include; WITTY WITCH, Gumby and Pokey are kidnapped by a helicopter-flying witch; HOT ROD GRANNY, an elderly lady takes Gumby’s car for a spin after she mistakes it for hers after breaking her glasses; IN A FIX, there mischief afoot among Gumby and Pokey’s toys and a couple of strange birds; KING FOR A DAY, Gumby saves the kingdom of Ott by jousting; THE GROOBEE, Gumby rides a giant bee on an animal hunt; GOPHER TROUBLE, a chemist gopher alters the appearance of corn plants into giant corn ears; RAIN FOR ROO, Gumby shows King Ott how to make rain for his dry kingdom; CHICKEN FEED, Gumby is stuck with a chicken the size of a house; THE ZOOPS, Gumby is sold a magic potion that turns watermelons into strange animals that cry “zoop”.
